result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre Dewayne Hill

records.addlTxt:
9:28 AM Defendant Deandre Dewayne Hill not in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Deandre Dewayne Hill.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Kuehn has been appointed. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. No action taken on bail. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed. Order Appointing Counsel
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  nk
Received and filed; Pretrial Services Status Report 10-18-2022

Defendant Deandre Dewayne Hill in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to Court from SPD regarding appointment of counsel, filed

Defendant Deandre Dewayne Hill appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Court ordered no contact with D.J. Peterson (Co-Actor)
See attached Map for Geographic Restrictions
North Meinecke Ave, South Lloyd Street, West 17th Street, East 2th Street
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deandre Dewayne Hill in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Deandre Dewayne Hill in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
